result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kedric I Simonsen

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
for adjournment of STC filed by Atty Watson.

Atty Dorothea Watson

Atty Dorothea Watson
Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

1:30 PM Defendant Kedric I Simonsen in court.  ADA Annie Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn is eligible for SPD waiting for attorney to be appointed. Court colloquy with Defn regarding time limits for preliminary hearing. Defn elects to waive time limits. STC scheduled.

2:51 PM Defendant Kedric I Simonsen in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Lexi Keyes in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not retained counsel. Court found good cause to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 2

2:23 PM Defendant Kedric I Simonsen in court, in custody.  Attorney Stanley V. Woodard in court for Kedric I Simonsen.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:14 PM Defendant Defendant in court, in custody.  Attorney Will Rice Anderson in court for defendant.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. State has not yet filed a Complaint. Arguments by parties. Court released defendant without bail.
